posts.name: Mitchell
posts.cooked:
From team 3381 we are currently trying to get 2+ note auto using pathplanner for our next competion. This is our first time using it and everything seems to be going alright. Except for some reason our rotation is fliped.

When you make a path it shows a preview of the path the robot will take. The robot moves to the desired location just fine but when its rotating it rotates the opposite direction then of the preview. So if preview rotates clockwise our robot rotates counterclockwise.

We end up in our desired location and rotate the correct number of degrees but it’s going the rotateing the wrong direction. Thank you for any solutions you can offer.

posts.name: Adithya Anand
posts.cooked: We had a similar issue when our wheel offsets were 180 degrees off. Does your robot rotate the correct direction when driving normally (in teleop)?

posts.name: Mitchell
posts.cooked: Yes it does, we do use the ctre swerve generator and after our swerve base was up we got teleop running smoothly

posts.name: Adithya Anand
posts.cooked: Are you inverting anything anywhere (ie. adding or subtracting 180)?

posts.name: Victoria
posts.cooked: I know this may sound very dumb but I had this very same issue. Pathplanner auto rotates based off of which side you are on (red or blue). Have you swapped your driverstation to the right color that your are testing? If you are on the wrong color it’ll flip your auton.

posts.name: Mitchell
posts.cooked: We have changed the cancoder offsets of our swerve to have the wheel align but i don’t think that would effect auto. Outside of that we do have inverted forward and backward on our driver controller just for ease of driving and that again souldn’t effect our auto, or atleast i don’t think it would

posts.name: Mitchell
posts.cooked: We have only tested it on blue side and we were had it on blue 3 while doing it. Next time i have access to our robot, tomorrow, ill see about red side.

posts.name: Adithya Anand
posts.cooked: Yeah, those inverts should be fine, since they are only translational and not rotational (and they shouldn’t affect the way the robot actually drives). What happens if you tell it to rotate only 90 degrees clockwise? Does it go 270 degrees the other way and ends up in the correct spot, or just rotate 90 degrees counterclockwise and end up 180 degrees off from where it should be?

posts.name: Mitchell
posts.cooked: It would rotate 90 degrees counterclockwise, and end up the opposite direction yes. When we were testing our auto it consitently keep rotating the opposite direction from what we wanted.

posts.name: Adithya Anand
posts.cooked: Alright. I am not entirely familiar with CTRE ’s swerve generator, we use our own swerve code, but it could be something involving pose and gyro. Can you tell if your pose rotates the same way as the robot in teleop? We were having an issue earlier where our pose was exactly 180 degrees off from where the robot was facing, and caused almost the exact problem you seem to be having.

posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked: Is your gyro and heading CCW positive?

posts.name: Mitchell
posts.cooked: What do you mean by CCW positive?

posts.name: Jack Tajkef
posts.cooked: Does the rotational value increase or decrease when you turn the robot counter-clockwise?

posts.name: 4573 Lead Mentor & Drive Coach
posts.cooked: Make sure the drivers station is set to a blue station

posts.name: Mitchell
posts.cooked: Our gyro is CCW Negative

posts.name: Jack Tajkef
posts.cooked: I’m pretty sure that Pathplanner polarity is CCW Positive so maybe you should try negating the rotation you are getting from your gyro. Which gyro are you using?

posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked:
You need to have a counter-clockwise rotation increase the gyro heading, and a clockwise rotation decrease it.  CCW+ is the shorthand for that.  You also want your gyro to return -180 to 180 for pathplanner, so the angles match.

For example, we use a navx, which is CW+, so when we update our odometry we have to negate it, and then update the odometry.

And our periodic odometry udpate:

You’ll want something similar to that to turn the correct direction.

posts.name: Mitchell
posts.cooked: pigion2

posts.name: Jack Tajkef
posts.cooked: Yeah, you need to negate your gyro value so that it is CCW Positive. If you need help with that let me know.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
